name: Old Fashioned
cocktailDescription: Born in early 19th-century New York, the Old Fashioned is a timeless blend of simplicity and strength. Best enjoyed on a chilly autumn evening with jazz in the background.

name: Negroni
cocktailDescription: Originating from early 20th-century Italy, the Negroni is a bold and balanced aperitif. Perfect for warm summer evenings on a terrace overlooking the city.

name: Daiquiri
cocktailDescription: Hailing from Cuba in the early 1900s, the Daiquiri combines rum and citrus in a refreshing embrace. Ideal for sunny afternoons by the beach or poolside relaxation.

name: Dry Martini
cocktailDescription: A symbol of sophistication from early 20th-century America, the Dry Martini is a crisp and elegant classic. Suited for stylish evenings and refined gatherings.

name: Margarita
cocktailDescription: Emerging from Mexico mid-20th century, the Margarita offers a vibrant mix of tequila and citrus. Best savored on warm summer nights with friends.

name: Manhattan
cocktailDescription: Crafted in 19th-century New York, the Manhattan is a rich and robust whiskey cocktail. Perfect for cozy winter evenings by the fireplace.

name: Mojito
cocktailDescription: A refreshing Cuban classic dating back to the 16th century, the Mojito blends mint and lime for a crisp taste. Ideal for hot summer days and lively gatherings.

name: Bloody Mary
cocktailDescription: Originating in the 1920s in Paris, the Bloody Mary is a savory brunch staple. Enjoy it leisurely on a lazy weekend morning to revive the senses.

name: Aperol Spritz
cocktailDescription: A beloved Italian aperitif from the mid-20th century, the Aperol Spritz is light and bittersweet. Perfect for warm afternoons and socializing al fresco.

name: Cosmopolitan
cocktailDescription: Popularized in the 1990s, the Cosmopolitan is a chic and tangy cocktail. Best enjoyed during lively urban nights and festive occasions.

name: Moscow Mule
cocktailDescription: Created in 1940s America, the Moscow Mule is a zesty and refreshing drink served in its iconic copper mug. Ideal for casual summer evenings.

name: Mai Tai
cocktailDescription: Born in post-war California, the Mai Tai is a tropical rum cocktail with exotic flavors. Best enjoyed poolside or during summer beach parties.

name: Pina Colada
cocktailDescription: Originating from Puerto Rico in the 1950s, the Pina Colada is a creamy tropical delight. Perfect for sunny beach days and festive summer celebrations.

name: Gin Tonic
cocktailDescription: With roots in colonial India, the Gin Tonic is a crisp and refreshing classic. Ideal for warm afternoons and casual social gatherings.

name: Long Island Iced Tea
cocktailDescription: Created in the 1970s, this potent mix combines several spirits for a bold experience. Best reserved for lively nights and festive celebrations.

name: French 75
cocktailDescription: Named after a WWI artillery gun, the French 75 is a sparkling and citrusy delight. Perfect for celebratory toasts and elegant occasions.

name: Bellini
cocktailDescription: Invented in Venice in the 1940s, the Bellini is a light and fruity sparkling cocktail. Ideal for spring brunches and sunny afternoons.

name: Sidecar
cocktailDescription: Dating back to post-WWI Paris, the Sidecar is a sharp and elegant cognac cocktail. Best enjoyed during crisp evenings and refined social events.

name: White Russian
cocktailDescription: Popularized in the 1960s, the White Russian is a creamy and indulgent cocktail. Perfect for cozy winter nights and relaxed evenings.

name: Caipirinha
cocktailDescription: Brazil's national cocktail, the Caipirinha is a zesty and refreshing mix of cacha√ßa and lime. Best enjoyed during summer festivities and outdoor gatherings.

name: Sazerac
cocktailDescription: Originating in 19th-century New Orleans, the Sazerac is a strong and aromatic cocktail. Ideal for contemplative evenings and classic cocktail enthusiasts.

name: Singapore Sling
cocktailDescription: Created in the early 20th century at Singapore's Raffles Hotel, this cocktail is a tropical and complex delight. Perfect for exotic evenings and resort relaxation.

name: Tequila Sunrise
cocktailDescription: Popularized in the 1970s, the Tequila Sunrise is a visually stunning and sweet cocktail. Ideal for bright mornings and festive gatherings.

name: Tom Collins
cocktailDescription: Dating back to the 19th century, the Tom Collins is a refreshing and citrusy classic. Perfect for sunny afternoons and garden parties.

name: Paloma
cocktailDescription: A popular Mexican cocktail, the Paloma combines tequila and grapefruit for a tangy refreshment. Best enjoyed on warm afternoons and casual gatherings.

name: Mimosa
cocktailDescription: Invented in the 1920s, the Mimosa is a light and bubbly brunch favorite. Perfect for celebratory mornings and springtime occasions.

name: Sex on the Beach
cocktailDescription: Emerging in the 1980s, this cocktail is a sweet and fruity crowd-pleaser. Ideal for beach parties and vibrant summer nights.

name: Irish Coffee
cocktailDescription: Created in mid-20th-century Ireland, the Irish Coffee is a warming blend of whisky and coffee. Best savored on cold evenings or after a hearty meal.
